If you’re hoping to get your hands on any face masks (especially the coveted N95), large-volume hand sanitizers, surgical gloves, or facial shields to help protect you or your family from COVID-19, don’t go looking on Amazon for them—because the company won’t sell any to you.

data.title: Amazon faces unprecedented challenges as dozens of its warehouses grapple with COVID-19 outbreaks
data.text: At least 30 of the fulfillment centers that power Amazon’s e-commerce business have outbreaks of COVID-19, according to local news reports and employee accounts.

data.title: More Amazon Workers Plan to Strike Over Lack of COVID-19 Protection
data.text: Employees say they want coronavirus-contaminated facilities to be closed and cleaned, and better protection from exposure at work.

data.title: Amazon Worker Who Was Fired After Coronavirus Walkout Says He Is ‘Being Silenced’
data.text: Christian Smalls took part in a walkout asking for Amazon's Staten Island warehouse to be closed after one worker tested positive, but believes he is being silenced for speaking out.

data.title: Dear Jeff Bezos, instead of firing me, protect your workers from coronavirus
data.text: I spoke up for safety at an Amazon warehouse. Unfortunately I believe it cost me my job

data.title: Union leaders, NY lawmakers pressure Amazon to reinstate fired protester
data.text: The protester, Christian Smalls, was terminated Monday.

data.title: Amazon warehouse workers protest near Detroit
data.text: Amazon.com Inc on Wednesday said a handful of workers staged a demonstration at one of its warehouses near Detroit, reflecting the ongoing concerns among its staff about contracting the coronavirus on the job.

data.title: Amazon workers plan strike at Michigan warehouse to call for coronavirus protections
data.text: The walkout follows one earlier this week at an Amazon warehouse in Staten Island, New York.

data.text: The New York City mayor Bill de Blasio has ordered an investigation into Amazon.com Inc.

data.title: Amazon investigated after firing worker who went on strike over coronavirus
data.text: New York City is investigating online retail giant Amazon after it fired a warehouse worker on the same day he participated in a strike protesting against the company's coronavirus response.

data.title: Independent worker group calls for Whole Foods 'sick out' over coronavirus
data.text: An independent group of workers at Whole Foods Market called on colleagues to phone in sick to the grocer's stores on Tuesday to protest what they say is a lack of adequate compensation and protections from the coronavirus.

data.text:
A Whole Foods sick out is in place as workers for the Amazon (AMZN) company push for more as the coronavirus from China continues to spread.

data.title: New York City to probe Amazon firing of warehouse worker
data.text: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio said on Tuesday he had ordered the city's human rights commissioner to investigate the dismissal of a worker at an Amazon.com warehouse who had participated in a walkout.

data.title: Some Whole Foods workers call for 'sick out'
data.text: A group of workers at Whole Foods Market called on others to phone in sick at all of the grocer's stores on Tuesday to protest what they say is a lack of adequate compensation and protections from the coronavirus.

data.title: Whole Foods Markets Workers Planning ‘Sick Out’ Today Over Coronavirus
data.text: Despite enhanced safety rules, a union petition says the grocer is ignoring employee health risks.

data.title: Amazon Fires Worker Who Led Warehouse Walkout Demanding Coronavirus Protections
data.text: Christian Smalls, an assistant manager at Amazon’s Staten Island warehouse, led a walkout on Monday demanding better protections against COVID-19, but was fired hours later.

data.title: Striking Amazon Worker Fired For 'Putting The Teams At Risk,' Employee Says He Tried To Protect Workers' Lives
data.text: A worker who organized a strike on Monday at Amazon Inc.’s (NASDAQ: AMZN) Staten Island facility has been fired after asking for more protection against Covid-19 infection.

data.title: The New York Post: Amazon fires organizer of strike at Staten Island warehouse
data.text: Amazon has fired the worker at its Staten Island warehouse who organized a walkout on Monday to demand greater protections from the company amid the coronavirus outbreak.

data.title: Amazon fires warehouse worker who led Staten Island warehouse walkout
data.text: Amazon has terminated an employee based in the company's Staten Island, New York, warehouse after he participated in a worker walkout protesting the company's response to the novel coronavirus.

data.title: On the front lines of today’s Amazon warehouse walkout: a labor organizer fired, another COVID-19 case
data.text:
A few dozen workers walked off the job today at the retail giant’s giant fulfillment center in Staten Island, NY—with the company firing a protest organizer by the end of the day claiming that he broke quarantine.
 On a cloudy day at Amazon’s massive distribution center in Staten Island, where thousands of workers toil to pack boxes for deliveries to home-bound Americans around the country, the coronavirus hit home in a dramatic way.

data.title: Amazon fires warehouse worker who led Staten Island strike for more coronavirus protection
data.text: Amazon said it fired Chris Smalls for 'violating social distancing guidelines and putting the safety of others at risk.'

data.title: Virus Prompts Workplace Protests Over Health Concerns
data.text: Instacart and Amazon are the latest targets of labor action by groups fearing coronavirus exposure on the job.

data.title: Instacart, Amazon workers strike as labor unrest grows during coronavirus crisis
data.text: Warehouse, delivery and retail gig workers in the United States went on strike on Monday to call attention to safety and wage concerns for people laboring through the coronavirus crisis.

data.title: Amazon workers in Staten Island protest coronavirus working conditions
data.text: Employee discontent is growing louder over Amazon's handling of worker health during the pandemic.

data.title: Workers go on strike at Amazon delivery site in Italy amid coronavirus
data.text: Around one-third of those working at an Amazon  delivery station in central Italy went on strike on Monday, a union representative said, citing a request for enhanced safety measures for workers amid the coronavirus health emergency.

data.text: It may be just a one-day thing, it may just be coincidence, it might not have happened if not for COVID-19.

data.text: Amazon will begin screening employee temperatures at warehouses in New York and Seattle this week amid growing unrest about workers’ exposure to COVID-19.

data.text: Instacart had 200,000 workers and is adding 300,000 more. That may not add up to 500,000, though.

data.text: Staff at the Staten Island warehouse are demanding closure of the facility and greater protections against the impact of COVID-19, after at least one worker tested positive for the virus.

data.title: Amazon Warehouse Workers Plan Monday Walkout To Protest Lack Of Coronavirus Protection
data.text: Amazon.com Inc.'s (NASDAQ: AMZN) workers at the company's Staten Island warehouse are planning a mass walkout on Monday to protest against what they call a lack of protection provided during the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic.

data.title: Amazon workers demand closure of Staten Island facility
data.text: Amazon employees at the company's Staten Island, New York, facility plan to walk off the job Monday amid allegations the online retail giant has mishandled its response to the coronavirus pandemic.

data.title: Amazon workers plan strike at Staten Island warehouse to demand coronavirus protections
data.text: JFK8 workers are walking out to demand that Amazon close the facility after an associate tested positive for the coronavirus.

data.title: Amazon Files Objection To DoD Motion To Revise Microsoft JEDI Decision
data.text: Amazon Web Services has filed an objection to the motion by the Department of Defense that would allow it to change details and pricing in the award of the $10 billion Joint Enterprise Defense Infrastructure cloud services contract.

data.title: 'They're putting us all at risk:' What it's like working in Amazon's warehouses during the coronavirus outbreak
data.text: Amazon workers feel the company hasn't done enough to protect them from catching the coronavirus while they're on the job.
